intro: Uncinia meridensis, commonly known as the southern hookweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, grassy habitats and is often found in open areas with well-drained soil. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are erect and branching. Uncinia meridensis is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed environments, making it a common weed in agricultural areas.
